qas.question: At what rough time did the Cambrian era start?
What were the continents of the Cambrian area believed to have formerly been a part of?
What continent moved to the southern-most part of the earth in the Cambrian era?
What continent ranged over the majority of the southern hemisphere of earth in the Cambrian?
Baltica and Sibera are examples of what thing, during the Cambrian era?
What period is a minor division in the geologic timescale?
What supercontinent was formed from the coninents of the Cambrian?
During what period were the oceans widespread and deep?
What drift rates were high during the Cambrian?
When did Pannotia begin to drift towards the South Pole?

context: <b5_0>The <b7_0><b9_0>Cambrian<b9_0/><b7_0/><b5_0/> is a major division of the geologic timescale that begins about <a0_0>541.0 ± 1.0 Ma.<a0_0/> Cambrian continents are thought to have resulted from the breakup of a Neoproterozoic supercontinent called <a1_0><b6_0>Pannotia<b6_0/><a1_0/>. The waters of the Cambrian period appear to have been widespread and shallow. <b8_0>Continental<b8_0/> drift rates may have been anomalously high. Laurentia, Baltica and Siberia remained <a4_0>independent continents<a4_0/> following the break-up of the supercontinent of Pannotia. <a2_0>Gondwana<a2_0/> started to drift toward the South Pole. <a3_0>Panthalassa<a3_0/> covered most of the southern hemisphere, and minor oceans included the Proto-Tethys Ocean, Iapetus Ocean and Khanty Ocean.
